result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshawn F Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges by 6-1-2015; any bail on deposit to be applied. if unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
No new violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
Court will grant expunction if defendant pays the fine and costs and successfully completes probation and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deshawn F Harris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deshawn F Harris in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Defendant ordered to serve 5 days in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:
*No new violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 06-01-2015; any bail on deposit to be applied.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. 

Court will will grant expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs and successfully successfully completes probation and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

Defendant Deshawn F Harris in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-04-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deshawn F Harris in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another pretrial date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court Defendant not to be in possession of any firearms or weapons during the pendency of this case. 
Court ordered the remaining balance of bail ($250.00) to be returned to the remitter.

Defendant Deshawn F Harris in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Reserve, Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant states he will retain counsel. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
